mdRecord.dcterms:title: Alderman Library
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Thompson, Ralph R.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: publicity photographs; from excerpt on photo: Papers and manuscripts of Ellen Glasgow, distinguished Virginia author, have been presented to the University of Virginia's Alderman Library by her literary executors in accordance with her wish that they be preserved at Mr. Jefferson's College. Examining the manuscript of her autobiography, The Woman Within are, left to right, Archibald B. Shepperson, chairman of the department of English, Francis L. Berkeley Jr., curator of manuscripts, and Jay B. Hubbell, retired Duke professor of American literature, who has been a visiting professor at the University of Virginia and working in Glasgow's papers.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Visual History Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: University of Virginia
